The FHIR narrative page at http://hl7.org/fhir/narrative.html#xhtml refers to the <div> tag quite a few times, and of course the actual element where the narrative goes is called div, but...

it doesn't seem like it mandates that the root tag actually be a <div> tag. Am I missing anything or would this be valid?

 "div": "<pre xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\">Hello</pre>"
The div in XML is an HTML div. The content can be any node that's allowed as a child of div
So.. @Lloyd McKenzie sorry, does that mean that my example above is valid or no? In JSON if the root element isn't a div is the div just implied?
Looks like convention says it's an error
the stadnard is trying to say that it must be a div. If you think it's not clear enough (naming it 'the div element') then you could create a task to clarify
